content: try double clicking the top bar of the application. OR press the maximise button in the top right of the screen.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
probably by uninstalling your antivirus product of choice. They have scam and spam tools that tend to do this sort of thing periodically. I think it was kaspersky last time. Seriously. But you could try the following to work through the steps to determine the cause.

1. Run Thunderbird in Troubleshooting mode. if you problems continue try 2. 2. Run Thunderbird in Troubleshooting mode while the operating system is in safe mode with networking.

Does Thunderbird act out in either of those circumstances?

What email provider do you use? What email protocol do you use?
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Perhaps refer to the user support documentation. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password

I do not know of a way to set a primary password without following the instructions in the link. It is not something that happens accidentally, so I would counsel you to be very sure it is a primary password you are looking for. Frequently when antivirus products drop their bundle and fail like some past date politician Thunderbird asks for account passwords again because the AV is messing with the connection.
creator: MattAuSupport
